snippet.title: Thomas Friedman
snippet.description: Thomas Friedman tells Jon about solar and wind energy alternatives.

snippet.title: Helen Thomas
snippet.description: Helen Thomas has been part of the Washington Press Corps for nine presidents -- her favorite was John F. Kennedy.

snippet.title: Thomas Friedman
snippet.description: Thomas Friedman believes the international economic playing field is being flattened by the Internet.

snippet.title: State of the Cutting Edge
snippet.description: The Stadium Pal is the perfect invention for those sports fans who suffer from male urinary inconvenience.

snippet.title: A Look Back - February 2012
snippet.description: Members of Congress skirt insider-trading laws, Rick Santorum smears Mitt Romney in Michigan, and Aasif Mandvi asks Rick Scott to take a drug test.

snippet.title: Difference Makers - Robert Ekas
snippet.description: Robert Ekas ensures the freedom of American society by giving the middle finger to every police officer he sees.

snippet.title: South Carolina's 4th District Primary - Bob Inglis
snippet.description: Bob Inglis should quit Congress and get a job at Olive Garden to convince the people of South Carolina he's not an incumbent.

snippet.title: Exclusive - David Barton Extended Interview Pt. 1
snippet.description: In this unedited, extended interview, David Barton discusses the hostility towards Christianity in America.

snippet.title: A Leak of Their Own - License to Spill
snippet.description: Jason Jones interviews former NSA whistleblower Thomas Drake, a man at war with the Obama administration and wasteful domestic spying programs.

snippet.title: Exclusive - Richard Beeman Extended Interview Pt. 2
snippet.description: Richard Beeman thinks the founding fathers made a conscious effort to create a secular Constitution in this unedited, extended interview.
